    Jimmy: Hi. My name is Jimmy and I'm a controller. I would like to give Planview Clarizen a four out of five star rating. For more reviews like this, please click below. We use Clarizen on daily basis for project management and that includes our operations department, entering timecards, fulfilling tasks, and completing projects for our customers. We love the fact that Clarizen has a lot of flexibility and different ways for us to customize the software to fit various needs for all departments; not just operations, but also sales and accounting. Especially when it comes to project details, task details, costs, and project information, there's just so many fields that we can use and report on. It really gives us a lot of detail on how our projects are doing. Clarizen has a lot of functionality. It can get very complicated and there is a steep learning curve. The cost can be pretty expensive especially when you account for all the consulting work that you'll probably need to do, especially if your company is pretty complex like ours with a lot of customization and needs for reporting done by other departments.

    April 16, 2023
    "Planview AdaptiveWork, an efficient way to manage our project portfolio and increase visibility."
    Overall: Planview AdaptiveWork is robust and effectively scalable. It has features and implementations that distinguish the brand and is widely adopted in multiple organizations.It has multiple key functionalities for any organization, such as project portfolio planning, intelligent resource management, email interaction, and mobile collaboration, as well as being excellent for project financial management. In general, its use creates an immediate positive impact on organizations, which are favored by increasing visibility and optimizing the use and collaboration of company personnel.
    Pros: Planview AdaptiveWork is an excellent platform for managing a large portfolio of projects without losing visibility into multitasking, making it ideal for fast-paced business environments. Additionally, we can quickly visualize those activities that require the most attention from project managers by quickly inspecting our Gantt charts or boards, and this follow-up can be related to the financial plan, resource management, or even registration and validation. of project milestones.With Planview AdaptiveWork we can make a comprehensive follow-up of our projects and reduce the costs associated with supervision since it guarantees efficient planning, execution, and control, in addition to the fact that it has the ability to make very complete reports for stakeholders.
    Cons: Planview AdaptiveWork is a very complete tool, capable of giving us 360-degree visibility, and it is easy to use by experienced project managers and trained in this branch of knowledge, however, it may be for those who do not know the theory in detail. In project management, it is a bit laborious to familiarize yourself with capacity planning, versioning, API support, critical path, and more.That being said, it is a great platform, developed to manage both small projects and project portfolios, and allows collaborative work in the organization.
    Switched From: Planview ProjectPlace
    Reasons for Switching to Planview AdaptiveWork: Planview AdaptiveWork is widely used and recommended on the Web and by project management professionals.

    May 9, 2018
    "PM tool is not bad, but integrated time/expense/invoice processing did not work."
    Overall: We got very little benefit from this software, as it did not perform as expected.
    Pros: Project management tool is comparable to MS Project. Users that are looking for a subscription PM product rather than purchasing MS Project may benefit from this software, but I am not sure if all PM features are available out-of-the-box at cheaper subscription levels.
    Cons: Although the PM tool is comparable to MS Project, it also comes with a level of complication also comparable to MS Project. Full functionality of PM (i.e. including resource management) requires buy-in by all departments/users in the company, and this is difficult to acheive in large or diverse organizations. Our company implemeted this software with the goal of bringing project management together with time reporting, expense reporting, and invoice processing. The purpose of implementing Clarizen was to have a centralized system where we could report project status by including all relevant metrics on the project in a list or detailed view, e.g. planned time vs. actual time, planned cost vs. actual cost, and project manager comments/narrative on goal vs. result. This purpose was never realized. Clarizen underestimated the work effort to develop customizations, which resulted in the time module never being completed, the expense/invoice modules were cumbersome to use, the related approval workflows had many problems, and support from Clarizen management was almost non-existent. We are now taking a different approach. No longer do we believe that one system can handle all our needs, and so we have adopted different systems with some integration between them to try to bring together all project-related data.
    Reviewer Source

    January 21, 2016
    "A mostly positive experience."
    Overall: We are implementing Clarizen as a project management tool for the entire organization but starting in the Information Technology and Performance Improvement departments. Our goal is to capture all project requests and projects in one place for review, approval, management, and reporting. Clarizen has mostly met our expectations so far. Most of the items that have not met our expectations are minor. We are still early in our implementation so there are still lessons to learn in our journey.
    Pros: 1. Unlimited email-only users. Resources that infrequently or rarely work on projects can report progress via email without consuming an expensive license. 2. Email and/or API integration with work order systems. Clarizen doesn't charge an expensive license to integrate it with other systems. 3. A modern-looking user interface with an emphasis on social media-like collaboration. 4. Lots of options for charts and graphs for reporting. 5. Can import spreadsheets and MS Project workplans. 6. Lots of training and support webinars every week. 7. Pre-recorded online training via the Clarizen University.
    Cons: 1. Support seems slow to respond to support requests. 2. There is currently a bug they haven't fixed yet that requires you to keep resetting column widths in reports and dashboards. They don't stick. 3. Their online self-help knowledge base seems new and thin. 4. They don't have a feature I used in other project management software to identify the last (most recent) note, comment, etc. on an item. This can be worked around via user training or some custom workflow programming but it would be nice if they built it in as others have.
    Reviewer Source

    August 18, 2015
    "Clarizen a great Project Management Tool"
    Overall: My team has used Clarizen for a little over a year now. I cannot say enough good things on how well it has done for my team and organizing the implementations of our Software. My team from an employee level up to management are able to use Clarizen to run their individual days and teams. We implement time and attendance software for clients and use Clarizen to organize our Projects with our specific timelines that we have. Clarizen makes it easy for employees to know exactly where they are at with all of their clients and allows management to easily track the progress of their teams.
    Pros: Customization. I cannot say enough on how exceptional the Clarizen technical team is with taking our needs and making them happen in the system. One specific example is I formulated a scoring system for incoming clients that based upon how they were going to use our system would be given a "complexity" score so that I could assign higher level clients to my best employees and lower level clients to my lesser experienced employees. Clarizen took my request that I submitted and within a month had the entire scoring system automated and up and running giving me a fantastic tool to use daily.
    Cons: Pricing. Clarizen needs to be able to add options on as fixed costs instead of raising the overall monthly rate. My team doesn't use every aspect of the program so when I need more of just one option in the system I shouldn't have to pay for a higher level across the board with more of all their options when I need just one. I am hoping that can change in the future to meet individual client needs.

    "Clarizen's deep set of tools"
    Overall: We've used Clarizen for a few years now, and it's made a huge difference. I came in with project management experience, but many of our managers were just winging it. We moved from a simple time-tracking application to Clarizen's full fledged Project Management. That was a bigger step than most were ready for, but it's come into its own. We have visibility to things we didn't have before, and can make data-driven decisions instead of gut-feeling our way along. I've been able to prove that instinct was not the correct choice in many cases. Clarizen won't tell you what to do, but whatever you want to do, you can probably do it with Clarizen. Other packages I've used gave you a methodology with their software, but Clarizen is flexible, nimble, and robust.
    Pros: -Lots of customization -SQL-like API calls -Detailed data -Does what it says on the tin
    Cons: -Lack of a canned process for organizations that don't know where to start -I wish it was cheaper :)

    "We can manage time, and financial affairs and track project progress accurately."
    Overall: The high-quality automation provided by Planview AdaptiveWork helped us prepare schedules in detail, as well as when making updates, we can extract all the information that expresses the fact of project completion, and we can also find expected delivery dates, as well as we can calculate delays, and manage the financial affairs of the project efficiently.
    Pros: with Planview AdaptiveWork, We can understand the project's actual situation and manage all our projects with high accuracy. Preparing time programs by Planview AdaptiveWorkis very organized and helps link activities and areas with correct relationships. Scheduling is done automatically to find the start and end dates for activities. It is excellent that Planview AdaptiveWork provides all the necessary contracting contracts and helps calculate the actual delay periods for claims. As for calculating the exact completion percentages and comparing them to the planned ones, Planview AdaptiveWork is excellent for this purpose. We can also follow up on the financial affairs efficiently, and the reports and charts that we prepare by Planview AdaptiveWork help to understand the project's financial situation properly.
    Cons: It is not easy to use, as a planning and scheduling specialist needs to understand all the tools and how they work correctly. Anyone who wants to take advantage of Planview AdaptiveWork's potential should spend appropriate time learning and training.

    August 22, 2016
    "Great project management system with good flexibility"
    Overall: Clarizen is a great platform for project management, workflow management and internal communication tracking. The reporting suite is also very good and there seems to be a keen drive to continually improve the product. Customer support throughout setup and launch was excellent with a product specialist available onsite, phone and web-conference to help train our team and customize our environment. Despite some challenging requests our support team and the flexibility of the system allowed to achieve near all our requirements thus far.
    Pros: Flexibility/Customisation - the system is extremely adaptable and can be used for a number of functions beyond that which it was designed because of it. Reporting - The reporting suite is excellent but there is still room for improvement in terms of pivots and lining relevant data in reports.
    Cons: Support - Although our setup support was great there can be a delay in resolving system bugs but no more than most software services. Caps on custom fields - There are caps on customisation depending on the package you choose and the price hike between them can be quite significant.
    Recommendations to other buyers: We reviewed a lot of solutions before deciding to use Clarizen, none seemed as flexible while also providing a comfortable user interface. It's not perfect and it has some quirks but no system is without them and it's adaptability should allow you to workaround most issues.

    "Intuitive, Flexible, yet Powerful"
    Overall: Clarizen is a great solution, which is proving to be an invaluable tool within our business. Despite having some very strictly defined processes that Clarizen were required to include, all of these were developed efficiently in full collaboration, even ensuring that developments were future proofed to ensure continued use with no requirement to pay out for additional development. The layout and ‘look and feel’ is crisp and clean while virtually everything on the page can be configured to ensure that it best fits the user’s requirements. Before implementing Clarizen it was difficult to get true visibility of how the portfolio of projects sat, where potential conflict of resourcing would occur. With the powerful calendar and resource tools that come as standard in Clarizen it has become easy to see these potential issues earlier, allowing for a more planned response which ultimately benefits our customers and strengthens our brand.
    Pros: Flexible and easy to use. Social interaction, with in-context discussion panels for all projects and tasks. Easy monitoring of time submissions. Great (and expanding) set of modules (Apps) that can be deployed to further enhance the solution.
    Cons: Reporting tools are still lacking, but this is actively being addressed with regular updates and improvements released.

    "Great tool for collaboration"
    Overall: Great product that allows for a ton of flexibility. It's been great to be able to customize for the specific needs of each team, yet still have all teams in the same product.
    Pros: The level to which you can customize, create custom actions and workflows, etc. is the best part of the product
    Cons: Implementation can be tricky. Your instance starts with everything turned on, it would be better to start with a minimal instance and turn things on as you need to implement.
    Recommendations to other buyers: Same as above -- have a clear plan for your implementation. Turn off all the features that you aren't going to use, and minimize the number of fields showing in the UI. This will help with adoption.
    Reviewer Source
    Source: Capterra

    "Clarizen has been a solid tool for us when expanding our professional services organization. "
    Overall: Visibility into projects across the entire professional services portfolio. This gave us a better understanding of our teams and how they were utilized.
    Pros: The ability to customize Clarizen is one of it's strongest features. As our organization grew, the financials and resource management became more important that detailed project plans so we struggled to find a balance of how detailed our WBSs should be because everything within the project plan was tied to time entries and drove project cost. It has become pretty administrative for some of our PMs.

    September 8, 2017
    "Very useful for getting everyone onto "one source of the truth""
    Overall: Biggest benefit is "one source of truth".
    Pros: The ease of use that comes from being a SaaS solution has been the strongest feature. In addition, because it is web-based, some of the configuration can be done using CSS, which does not take a lot of programmatic experience to implement.
    Cons: As a PPM, there are still gaps (as of this writing) in some basic PPM functionality. The most glaring to me is the lack of Capacity Planning functionality. It can handle Resource Allocation, and Resource Loading, but if you are looking for a way to forecast out what your expected capacity for future work is, you can only do it through heavy configuration. As for configuration, it has pros and cons, but one of the more challenging limitations is in changing a custom field. If, for example, you decide that the data type on a field must be changed from string to number, you cannot simply change the data type. You must create a new field with the correct data type, find all the configuration instances where that field exists (in, for example, custom actions you've programmed Clarizen to take) and replace them, then delete the old field. It's a very clunky process. The last big con we have found is that there is no archiving of data. If you want to archive your data, you must dump everything out into a EDW of some sort. This is doubtlessly to keep the database slim, but that means that the system is always an "As Is" system, and you lose the ability to analyze trends.
    Reviewer Source

    January 20, 2016
    "It Can Do Just About Anything...*"
    Overall: *...with the right knowledge of programming or significant investment in their custom programming services. If you can think it, Clarizen can probably do it. It's that flexible. That's my all-encompassing endorsement of the app. It's just that good! On the downside, the app can be a little slow at times--mainly slow page loads or inconsistent page refreshing. There are minor oddities and head-scratchers here and there (like it won't load more than 50 items on a page at a time without waiting for a further page reload), but we've been willing to settle for those quirks in exchange for the system's incredible flexibility and powerful tools, configuration, filtering, reporting, etc. One other thing that is of note... we have been using the app for 2 years and have had at least 4 different account reps. And they all have three things in common: they tend to want to only speak with you by appointment, they seem to be in a hurry when they do speak to you, and they are always ready and willing to sell you something without listening very well. So just be prepared for that and demand that they slow down. Tech support is thorough, but slow and sometimes it takes a while to get resolution to issues that aren't life-threatening. All-in-all, we've found Clarizen to be the most flexible, versatile, powerful tool out there. All of the people we've dealt with are likable and eager to help...just not on our terms, which is the place they could improve the most.

    "Very capable, customizable & user friendly "
    Pros: This product is very capable. This does mean that it can be complex however. There will be a learning curve based on the level of use your interested in using the software for. It did not take us long to figure out how to start entering projects and tasks. The admin role can be a little overwhelming, but the user role is pretty straight forward.
    Cons: The team at Clarizen has been very diligent in their training approach. I'm sure they do so to ensure their clients' success. For us though, it's been too slow. If you know how to use Microsoft Project or other project management software, a lot of the training they will go through is common knowledge.
    Recommendations to other buyers: Clarizen offers a free trial and free webinars. I would dig in and build out a sample project including milestones and tasks and set due dates for each of them. Don't be discouraged as things might not be completely clear at first. But, we started creating projects and using the software before our first training session and it helped.

    January 23, 2015
    "Highly Customizable SaaS Tool with Great Overall Value"
    Pros: Clarizen (V6) is likely the most configurable SaaS tool available in the PPM world. The ability to customize fields and workflows to support unique processes is a major selling point of the tool. The new native mobile app is great. Customer support, access to training and, professional services are all excellent.
    Cons: Out of the box, the tool can be a little overwhelming, with few preconfigured workflow options (cases, etc.). Because the tool has an extremely robust configuration/customization engine, there is/are some functionality/utilities that require customization (and thus more custom fields/actions) that most would probably expect to be available out of the box. The weakest point is the interactive Gantt chart, which has very limited configuration options.
    Recommendations to other buyers: Don't bother with a Professional license unless you truly plan on using it as an evaluation phase before moving up to Enterprise unless you have very basic needs. Dialing in the workflow requires custom fields/actions, which the Professional level barely provides. Take advantage of Clarizen's approach to training. They have daily free webinars and lots of documentation
    Reviewer Source

    Video User Reviews for Planview AdaptiveWork
    Listen to customers review their experience with Planview AdaptiveWork.
    By Jimmy S.•January 5, 2022
    Jimmy: Hi. My name is Jimmy and I'm a controller. I would like to give Planview Clarizen a four out of five star rating. For more reviews like this, please click below. We use Clarizen on daily basis for project management and that includes our operations department, entering timecards, fulfilling tasks, and completing projects for our customers. We love the fact that Clarizen has a lot of flexibility and different ways for us to customize the software to fit various needs for all departments; not just operations, but also sales and accounting. Especially when it comes to project details, task details, costs, and project information, there's just so many fields that we can use and report on. It really gives us a lot of detail on how our projects are doing. Clarizen has a lot of functionality. It can get very complicated and there is a steep learning curve. The cost can be pretty expensive especially when you account for all the consulting work that you'll probably need to do, especially if your company is pretty complex like ours with a lot of customization and needs for reporting done by other departments.
